ARABIC: قَالَ لَمْ أَكُن لِّأَسْجُدَ لِبَشَرٍ خَلَقْتَهُۥ مِن صَلْصَٰلٍ مِّنْ حَمَإٍ مَّسْنُونٍ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: He said, 'I will not prostrate to a human being whom You have created out of dried clay formed from fetid black mud.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: How could I bow," said he, "before a mortal whom You created from fermented clay dried tingling hard?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: He said: "It does not behove of me to prostrate myself before a human being whom You have created out of dry ringing clay wrought from black mud."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Iblis replied, "I did not want to prostrate before a human being whom You have created out of mud-moulded clay".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: He answered, “It does not befit me to prostrate myself to a human whom You have created from sounding clay made out of black smelly mud.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: [Iblis] said: "I am not one to prostrate myself to a human, whom You created from dried (sounding) clay of altered mud."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: He said: I am not such that I should make obeisance to a mortal whom Thou hast created of the essence of black mud fashioned in shape.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Said he, 'I would never bow myself before a mortal whom Thou hast created of a clay of mud moulded.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: He said: I am not one to prostrate myself unto a mortal whom Thou hast created out of potter's clay of black mud altered!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: He replied, "I am not one to prostrate myself to a man whom You have created out of a clay of moulded mud."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: He said it was not for me that should prostrate myself unto a human being whom Thou hast created from ringing clay of loam moulded.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Said he, ‘I will not prostrate before a human whom You have created out of a dry clay [drawn] from an aging mud.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: (Iblis) said: "I am not one to prostrate myself to man, whom Thou didst create from sounding clay, from mud moulded into shape."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: [Iblis (Satan)] said: "I am not the one to prostrate myself to a human being, whom You created from sounding clay of altered black smooth mud."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: He replied: 'I will not prostrate to a mortal You have created of clay, from molded mud'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: He said, “I am not about to prostrate myself before a human being, whom You created from clay, from molded mud.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: He said, "Never would I prostrate to a human whom You created out of clay from an altered black mud."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [15:33] Said he, ‘I was not about to prostrate myself, I should not prostrate myself, before a mortal whom You have created out of a dry clay [drawn] from malleable mud’.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (He said: Why should I prostrate myself unto a mortal whom Thou hast created out of potter's clay of black mud altered?) he said: it is not becoming of me to prostrate to clay.
